Key Arguments: Misinformation and disinformation do not pose a threat to the safety and wellbeing of Australians.
The proposed legislation threatens the autonomy and right to free speech of Australians.
An unelected body should not have the power to decide what is considered truth.
The government should listen to the people and protect their right to free speech.
Notable Quotes: I do not believe misinformation or disinformation pose a threat to the safety and/or wellbeing of Australians.
The government trying to introduce a new law to allow a single ‘unelected’ body to make our decisions is a significant threat to the autonomy and right to free speech of ALL Australians.
No single organisation (and certainly not one funded by the government) have the right to decide what is ‘truth’.
